nodes.title: II.1. Stelae and accompanying structures: Funerary and non-funerary structures
Other pillars
nodes.body: A non-uniform tabular pillar (1.1 m x 1.9 m) is situated 16.5 m uphill/west of pillar group 1. This standing stone is made of the same bluish rock and its broad sides face north and south. There are two smaller pillars (30 cm and 50 cm high) situated 37 m north of pillar group 1. The vestiges of other small pillars and walls seem o be distributed over nearby sandy slopes. Due to stringent time limitations, these more superficial dispersions could not be surveyed.55

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS1
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS1 (9.6 m x 9.6 m) is a square enclosure aligned in the cardinal directions (05.44΄ / 10.44΄ / 4600 m). FS1 occupies an isolated position on the edge of the plain. This enclosure appears to primarily have single-course perimeter walls, but there are also a couple sections along the perimeter that may be of double-course construction. The upright variable-length unshaped stones (20 cm to 70 cm long) of the walls project 10 cm to 40 cm above the ground surface. The interior is free of structural elements.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS2
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS2 is a single-course rectangular enclosure aligned in the compass points (05.60΄ / 10.47΄). It measures 5 m (east-west) x 2.8 m (north-south). The south and east walls of this enclosure have been largely destroyed. The walls contain variable-length rocks (up to 70 cm long) that were laid edgewise in he ground. These unshaped stones project as much as 30 cm from the ground surface. The interior is free of structural elements.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS3
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS3 (3.9 m x 3.9 m) is situated 13 m north of FS2. This single-course enclosure has an open interior. Its perimeter walls are single-course and are composed of unshaped upright stones 20 cm to 70 cm in length, which project 5 cm to 40 cm above ground level.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS4
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS4 is situated 4 m north of FS3. This unusually designed funerary structure is comprised of 12 interconnected square cells. FS4 is aligned in the cardinal directions, and measures 29.4 m (north-south) x 2 m (east-west). This structure has single-course perimeter walls, which contain upright stones up to 70 cm in length, which project as much as 35 cm from the ground surface. The 12 cells (2 m x 2 m) form a single line of structures, and are separated from one another by a distance of 40 cm to 90 cm. These cells appear to have open interiors despite the presence of many small stones strewn all over FS4.

nodes.title: Notes
nodes.body: [55] In this particular case, the pared down survey team was on horseback and had to cross back to our camps on the north side of the frozen Yarlung TsangpoYar lung gtsang po before nightfall.
